result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon D Gainer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 12 months or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called @ 3:10 PM Defendant Sheldon D Gainer appeared by video, in custody at RGCI. Attorney Paul Edward Zilles appeared in court for Sheldon D Gainer. Attorney Dennis Ryan appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Defendant understands the charges.  NGP entered. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. No objection by Atty Zilles. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
